item.title: Systems Integrator
item.description:
Description

Position:             Systems Integrator    
Location:             Kitchener, ON     
Job Type:            Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        2-5 years of relevant work experience
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment over the year (travel mostly contained to Canada and USA).  Trips to site would typically be 2 weeks on - 2 weeks off during the project integration phase.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software
  • Have Spanish as first, second or third language.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Deployment Specialist
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:         Project Engineer / Technical Deployment Specialist
Location:        Kitchener, ON
Job Type:       Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    3-5 years
Education:     College Diploma or Bachelors in relevant field
Division:        OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com. 

About the Job

The primary objective of the Technical Deployment Specialist (TDS) role is to act as the technical coordinator for a project during the deployment phase, and support to the operations during the managed services phase. Reporting to the General Manager Managed, the Technical Deployment Specialist works closely with the assigned Project Manager (PM) and Systems Engineers (SE’s) to understand and lead the technical aspects of a project. The Technical Deployment Specialist tracks and resolves technical issues and acts as Tier 1 support for both the Project Manager and the Systems Engineer (SE) assigned to the project, as well as coordinates on product level with internal departments and subcontractors. The Technical Deployment Specialist is the technical bridge/universal translator between the Project Deployment team and the OTTO Motors Engineering team.

 Primary responsibilities include:

  • Supplement the project ‘voice of the customer’ at the technical level to the internal product organization and towards subcontractors and interact effectively with varied departments.
  • Work with the Project Managers and Systems Engineers to plan and deploy projects after receiving a PO and leading up to and including a Site Acceptance Test.
  • Gain a broad exposure to all aspects of the OTTO Motors technology (AMR SW, AMR HW, Infrastructure (Fleet Manager SW, IT policies, Networking), Product capabilities/limitations, and best practices for all current and recent past products.)
  • Coordinate with subcontractors on a technical level to translate customer requirements into technical design specifications, testing criteria and successful delivery of technological solution by subcontractors.
  • Coordinate timely supply of products to customer site from internal organization and from subcontractors.
  • Gain a working knowledge of the processes and workflows of the PMO and those of other OTTO Motors teams.
  • Have a familiarity with and understand the principal functions of all information systems used at OTTO Motors such as: Epicor, Jira, Salesforce, Elastic/Kibana, Wiki, Google Suite, OTTO Motors Knowledge Base, Arena/PLM.
  • Pre-configure Fleet Manager OVA\'s (installation files) for deployment at customer sites and assist with issues arising during the installation process.
  • Act as primary IT/network SME on active deployments and assigned upgrades.
  • Troubleshoot issues with any of the aforementioned topics quickly and effectively, escalating in a timely manner when an issue requires a solution from a SME.
  • Coordinate handling of issues and quality defects in case support required from internal suppliers or external subcontractors
  • Assist with robot diagnostic data collection and primary triage for root cause analysis or escalation to Tier III or Tier IV support.
  • Reduce the number of \'direct-to-engineering\' escalations arising from on-site issues; this lets the developers focus on new features without getting distracted by minor issues.
  • Collaborate with OTTO Motors Engineering and subcontractors to troubleshoot product related project issues.
  • Keep track of the state of multiple project assignments at any given time, and maintain information records for each, during the full lifetime of the contract.
  • Self-prioritize workloads, often when under multiple \'crisis\' situations at customer sites.
  • Communicate effectively with SMEs, other OTTO Motors employees (of varying levels of technical expertise), as well as with subcontractors and with the customer.
  • Translating high-level technical concepts into easy-to-understand terms.
  • Prepare technical documentation about each deployment to facilitate the transition from the deployment phase to the support phase.
  • Understand the product capabilities and limitations and explain the context of each to different parties, including internal to OTTO Motors.

 

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

 Desired skills:

  • 3-5 years of relevant experience in a technical customer-facing role
  • Bachelor’s degree or college diploma in engineering or other technical field
  • Excellent organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to prioritize and analyze difficult issues
  • Strong negotiation and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced high mix low volume environment
  • Ability to work unsupervised while still effectively achieving goals
  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn new skills and tools
  • Background or exposure to an industrial automation environment
  • Proven ability to work cooperatively with others in a team environment
  • Ability to work effectively with internal departments and/or subcontractors
  • Technical writing/communication

 At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Account Executive
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:             Account Executive
Location:             Waterloo, Ontario              
Experience:        3+ years\' experience
Division:              Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job 

Clearpath Robotics’ Research Systems team is looking for a well organized, relationship-oriented Account Engineer with proven skills across all account functions: business development, direct technical sales, and account management.

As our newest Account Executive, your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Review client projects and applications, and assist in the scoping & configuration of application-appropriate robotic solutions for customers, independently and in collaboration with our team of Engineers 
  • Gains customer acceptance by explaining or demonstrating product features and software
  • Submits orders by conferring with technical support staff and costing engineering changes.
  • Provide company, product, and technical overview presentations
  • Provide pre-sales quotes to customers in a timely manner
  • Check purchase orders for accuracy against the quote or standards before processing Provide technical assistance to the customers - answering technical queries and perform research when answers are not immediately available
  • Successfully promote and sell Clearpath as a full-service robotic solutions provider
  • Maintain and develop a high level of knowledge of new technology and the company’s solution offerings
  • Contributes to sales engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed, 

About You

Our next Account Executive is a sharp, articulate and collaborative person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to everyone from grad students to CEOs to rocket scientists. You dream of being part of a close-knit sales team that attacks new challenges with a bear hug and thrives equally on collaboration and friendly competition.

You have an innate drive to be successful, and you bring both the acumen and the grit to achieve your objectives.

Our ideal candidate is someone who is described by friends as:

  • Entrepreneurial and resourceful
  • A confident and articulate speaker with the ability to think on their feet
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Able to understand and communicate technical concepts
  • Exceptional organization and attention to detail
  • Dynamic, dependable and diligent
  • Highly motivated and self-starting
  • Passion for helping customers solve complex problems with innovative technology

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 3 years’ experience of proven excellence in business development, inside sales and/or sales
  • Technical degree or equivalent experience
  • Ability to translate technology features into business benefits
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong initiative and ability to work in a self-directed environment
  • Organization and priority setting skills and ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity and expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Director, Industrial Sales
item.description:
Description

Position:          Director, Vertical Sales
Location:         Kitchener, ON or Remote/Virtual Canada
Experience:     12 + Years’ experience selling technical products
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent
Division:         OTTO Motors

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Reporting Directly to the Co-President Sales & Service, the Director, Vertical Sales is ultimately responsible for generating profitable Bookings for their specific Market Vertical. Success will be measured by achieving budgeted KPI’s of Bookings, Revenue, Contribution Margin and Free Cash Flow. The Director will collaborate with the GTM Team throughout the entire Sales process establishing GTM strategies including but not limited to Marketing, Business Development, Key Account Management and Client Development.

You will:

  • Cultivate a high-performance sales team that are driven to exceed expectations through hiring, mentoring, coaching, training and professional development 
  • Monitor and drive market intelligence in terms of the current landscape including market trends, customer insights, emerging applications and competitive analysis
  • Network with customers and industry experts to gather intelligence related to Product requirements as input to Product Engineering for prioritization of the Product Roadmap
  • Collaborate with Marketing, Business Development and Product Engineering to develop and execute the GTM playbook for your specific Market Vertical
  • Devise account strategies that leverage OTTO solutions and go-to-market strategy to expand OTTO within target accounts
  • Establish annual and monthly sales objectives in coordination with the companies budgeting process and business planning
  • Monitor the integrity of the data in SalesForce and work with the Account Executives to ensure that the data is always accurate as well as insightful to the broader organization
  • Maintain an accurate monthly unit, bookings and revenue forecast that is shared with Finance and Manufacturing for the purpose of forecasting and capacity planning
  • Ability to engage, collaborate, and manage applicable partner relationships in key opportunities and accounts to maximize customer value and impact. 

 

Required Skills and Experience: 

  • University degree in a STEM, Business or related field
  • Minimum 12+ years of relevant industry experience in a variety of technical roles including Applications Engineering, Project Management and Technical Sales
  • Proven people management experience to lead a high performing team
  • Proven track record of building sales plans that drive sales targets
  • Excellent communication skills, and the ability to deliver compelling presentations to prospects, customers, and partners.
  • An encouraging, communicative leadership style and ethic of mentoring and coaching 
  • Experience selling to mid market and enterprise organizations
  • Strategic thinker who is also hands-on to get results
  • Ability to travel to customers 25-50% of the time.

 

Ideal Sales Characteristics:

  • Coachability – ability to understand feedback and change behaviour
  • Curiosity – ability and desire to ask probing questions
  • Prior Success – based on previous sales results and/or ambition
  • Intelligence – ability to become a subject matter expert
  • Emotional Intelligence – self awareness, self management, social awareness and relationship building with others 
  • Passion – brings an intense enthusiasm to the team
  • Work Ethic – willingness to put in the extra effort to succeed
  • Preparation – technical aptitude of product and market/buyer understanding
  • Competitiveness – a drive to succeed that enables higher performance
  • Adaptability - ability to adapt and succeed in a fast-paced environment
  • Culture Fit – fit with company core values and culture

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Assistant Regional Chief – Track – Eastern region
item.description:
Job Summary

The Assistant Regional Chief - Track is responsible for providing reliable and safe engineering track infrastructure to maximize network availability and train velocity to support operations. The incumbent delivers improved efficiency in the designated region.

Main Responsibilities

Organic Growth

·       Oversee track maintenance and track services

·       Reduce train delays and provide safe plant to operate on

·       Drive completion of capital projects on time and on budget to create additional capacity and maintain existing infrastructure

·       Implement sustained systems and processes to ensure a proactive approach to problem solving

·       Ensure prompt response to engineering-related outages to minimize downtime and include reducing work block overruns on an annual basis

Safety

·       Develop a top of the class safe environment for injuries and accidents across the territory

·       Eliminate Serious Injury Fatality (SIF) potential injuries

·       Reduce and eliminate track unit collisions and Main Track Authority Violations (MTAV)

·       Drive compliance to regulations and the Engineering Tracks Standards (ETS)

Cost Efficiencies

·       Effective labor management and carrying out capital projects to ensure improved productivity

·       Oversee yearly operating and capital budgets as well as drive efficiencies to improve performance

Technology, Automation, and Analytics

·       Use data and analytics to monitor track condition and ensure capital as well as maintenance programs are carried out in priority order to improve reliability and maintain a safe operation

·       Leverage innovation to achieve business objectives

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office and field environment. The role will be partially performed outdoors (33%) in various types of weather and environmental conditions. The role requires being available on-call 24/7 to respond to critical incidents. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress. The role requires frequent travel (50%) within the territory.

Requirements

Experience

Relevant Work Experience

·       Minimum 10 years of relevant work experience

o   Experience in overseeing a vast territory

o   Demonstrate sustained performance through different seasonal cycles

o   Experience in managing large capital projects successfully

o   Experience in communicating change

o   Experience in testing for safety compliance and managing safety action plans

o   Exposure to other operating functions and various territories*

*Any experience for these above would be considered as an asset

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering*

*Any skills/attributes for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Knows the business and stays current on industry needs

·       Collaborates with others and shares information

·       Applies critical thinking

·       Demonstrates agility and drives change

·       Considers ESG principles in all operations

·       Identifies potential safety and security risks

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Technical skills and engineering proficiency

·       Technological aptitude

·       Knowledge of rail industry

·       Knowledge of collective agreements and bargaining skills

·       Knowledge of engineering systems and new technology

 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Senior Manager, Financial Planning Basic Capital
item.description:
At CN, everyday brings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environment where you’re part of making sure our business is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We provide the kind of paid training and opportunities that long-term careers are built on and we recognize hard workers who strive to make a difference. You will be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Senior Manager Financial Planning – Engineering Basic Capital acts as a trusted business advisor and contributor to the success of the Engineering business unit’s financial deliverables. This position provides financial insights to build a better business - proactively driving value through informed and insightful decision-making, fostering a culture of cost consciousness, control, simplification and continuous improvement.

The position has the primary day-to-day responsibility for planning, implementing, managing and controlling all financial activities within the Engineering Basic Capital portfolio. Critical outcomes include supporting the Engineering VP and his leadership team with key financial insights and operational analytics.  

The position plays a key role in developing, executing and evaluating the implementation of a financial strategy with the Engineering VP and his leadership team with emphasis on maintaining the most effective use of capital allocated to the function in any given year.

Main Responsibilities

Management Reporting and Financial Management Processes – 30%

  • ·        Ensure management reporting and financial management processes are dynamic and relevant to the business to drive performance
  • ·        Provide Engineering VP and his leadership team with guidance and advice on their capital expenditures, trends and metrics; make recommendations for management action
  • ·        Direct and validate the preparation and distribution of periodic reports on capital expenditures and key performance metrics, including performing various analyses as required
  • ·        Identify gaps and provide recommendations to strategically enhance financial performance, create business opportunities, and provide a full range of financial solutions
  • ·        Actively pursue opportunities to deliver cost savings and create efficiency gains
  • ·        Direct the development and analysis of business cases for the function’s capital investment proposals
  • ·        Provide appropriate oversight on capital spend versus project advancement
  • ·        Recommend industry benchmarks for measuring financial and operational performance

Budgeting and Planning Processes – 30%

  • ·        Manage budgeting and planning processes, ensuring that they are agile and aligned with evolving business needs
  • ·        Direct and translate the corporate business plan into a long-term, multi-year capital investment plan with a focus on optimal prioritization and allocation of funding to maximize returns for CN      
  • ·        Ensure buy-in by key budget stakeholders/owners by making them understand assumptions and key elements used, with the goal of increasing accountability
  • ·        Monitor, analyze and explain monthly financial results against budget
  • ·        Manage the preparation of financial outlooks and forecasts, including the communication of risks and merits associated with any proposed changes
  • ·        Manage changes and transfers within the capital budget
  • ·        Drill down on unexpected variances to provide explanations to key stakeholders and establish corrective actions through discussions with Engineering leadership
  • ·        Take a hands-on leadership position in developing, implementing and maintaining comprehensive financial forecasting systems

Continuous Improvement, Controls and Day-to-Day Support – 30%

  • ·        Ensure that effective controls are in place to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP) including project monitoring and reporting
  • ·        Proactively review and implement new processes triggered by new accounting pronouncements, new systems or evolving business requirements
  • ·        Provide recommendations and procedural improvements for financial audit issues and controls
  • ·        Liaise with internal and external auditors, as well as Accounting, on items related to internal financial controls
  • ·        Ensure the integrity of financial transactions created by the department, in compliance with corporate accounting rules
  • ·        Respond to questions, provide day-to-day support to Engineering staff pertaining to financial processes and systems; provide them with financial insights and training in order for them to perform the administrative portion of their duties adequately

Talent Development – 10%

  • ·        Lead, coach and develop a team of professionals in finance
  • ·        Partner and engage with Engineering leadership to mentor and educate the department on business processes and controls
  • ·        Accelerate the depth, and in some cases, execute succession plans and advance key employee development plans
  • ·        Ensure the professional well-being of all members in the team (learn, grow and prosper)

Working Conditions

The work is carried out primarily in an office environment. The employee must be able to work autonomously, as well as manage priorities and a high level of stress on a daily basis. Business travel will be required.

Requirements

Experience

Financial Leadership or Operational Role

·        Minimum 10 years of experience in progressively responsible financial leadership or operational roles

Education/Certification/Designation

  • ·        Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Commerce, or Engineering
  • ·        Master’s Degree in Business Administration (MBA) or working towards
  • ·        Chartered/Certified Professional Accountant (CPA) designation or working towards

Competencies

  • ·        Know the business and stay current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work performance
  • ·        Apply analytical thinking to make recommendations that drive sustainable performance
  • ·        Inspire others with impactful communications and adapt well to a given audience
  • ·        Initiate, influence and drive organizational changes to enable business transformation
  • ·        Innovate to create value, without compromising on safety
  • ·        Collaborate with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity
  • ·        Show initiative and empower others to raise our collective game
  • ·        Share timely information within and across functions to get things done effectively
  • ·        Develop and empower self and others to ensure CN’s success through continuous feedback and coaching

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·        Deep knowledge of railway operations business processes and metrics, particularly those related to the Engineering function

·        Knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting and cost control principles

·        Extensive knowledge of CN\'s financial and accounting reporting systems, including various SAP modules and Essbase

·        Strong computer skills: Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, MS-SQL), Fieldglass, Ariba, PMA, ECPS, TIS, etc.

·        Capacity to synthesize large amounts of data into meaningful insight

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist Project Management PMO
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

Are you passionate about finding better ways to do things? Can you spot potential problems a mile away? Do you want to be part of CN’s strategy in redefining the railroad through I&T transformation?  If yes, then we may have the role for you!

As a Project Portfolio Specialist, you will drive central planning, dependency management and executive reporting. You will be working across the Office of the CITO and I&T. Working with various teams, you will produce the overall transformation plan including outcomes, milestones, and dependencies. This will provide transparency of progress and help us to make sure we deliver amazing propositions for colleagues and business partners. 

 

Depending on the team, most of our roles offer flexible working and you will work remotely temporarily due to COVID-19.

 

Main Responsibilities

Reporting into the Office of the CITO, the PPO Specialist will be responsible for supporting the organization\'s PPO team, helping to ensure that projects stay on track by tracking the status of transformation deliverables, milestones, and financials.

Project Governance

 ·         Assist with the assessment and analysis of proposed project investments 

 ·         Review Project Change Requests.

 ·         As part of a team understand the detail of projects and provide governance advice to project teams.

 ·         Support project teams in project financial, risk and issue management as directed.

 ·         Monitor the portfolio to ensure compliance to Project Delivery Life Cycle (PDLC- CN Operating Model).

 ·         Review project closeout documentation for accuracy and completion.

 ·         Maintain repository and act as custodian of PPO policies, standards, artifacts, and procedures.

 ·         Support the implementation and maintenance of the PPO quality strategy.

 ·         Support Project Managers where necessary in project initiation, planning, execution, or control.

 ·         Assist in strategic and budgetary planning processes (as needed).

 

Benefits Realization

  •  Support the review of benefits and provide advice to enhance the quality of the benefits
  •  Work with business units to ensure the tracking of project benefits.
  • Collect and analyze data on benefits realization.

 

Portfolio Management

  • Support the production of pipeline data analysis across dependencies, key resource needs, priorities, and benefits.
  • Support project quality management planning, project health checks and lessons learned
  • Work across the portfolio to monitor the delivery of project outcomes.
  • Support the portfolio and project management tools to ensure accurate, relevant, and up-to-date information.
  • Develop Management Reports to provide stakeholders with transparency on the progress and health of projects and the portfolio.
  • Manage project intake process along with any incoming engagement needs.

Continuous Improvement

  • Lead ad hoc studies and investigations.
  • Provide project management guidance to other members of the team.

 

  Project Management Methodology

  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of Operating processes, templates, and systems.
  • Support the Office of the CITO communication and change activities to ensure all stakeholders are informed of the latest PPO processes.
  • Provide introduction, briefing and uplift sessions on governance and project management related processes.
  • Responsible for collecting and consolidating transformation data from a variety of sources for analytics (time, scope, change, budget, benefits, risk, quality) and to produce regular reports and presentations for all levels of governance and key stakeholders.
  • Develop PPO processes and provide training, coaching, oversight, and continuous improvement.
  • Managing the integrated transformation roadmap and associated financials.

Skills

Problem Solving and Judgment: Uses sound judgment and flexibility when recommending appropriate options and solutions; taking a broad scale, long-term view, assessing options and implications; committed to a course of action to accomplish a long-range goal or vision; guides others toward making effective decisions.

Results Orientation: Maintaining operational effectiveness in an environment that contains ambiguity and uncertainty; develops plans and strategies that are ambitious but realistic; and achieves results through others in a positive fashion that balances the interest of CN I&T.

Interpersonal Relationships: Possesses tremendous honesty and integrity; displays strong sense of character and humility; engages in creative approaches to managing team dynamics; values others, focusing on individual uniqueness and preserving an individual’s dignity.

Teamwork: Believing in, supporting, and championing project team members, focuses on creating an environment that strives to meet the voice of the team through the ability to empathize, understand, build rapport, show concern, encourage, engage and connecting with team members; uses sound ethical practices in carrying out operational duties.

Leadership/motivational: Maintains a sense of the big picture and the ability to communicate and mobilize people around a shared vision; engages in a leadership style that is appropriate to the project, person, task, and situation; involving others.

Analysis: Makes credible recommendation based on reports and statistics and ensures that decisions are implemented; reviews decisions considering changed circumstances.

Project Management: Establishes priorities, tasks, and work schedules in advance, maximizes the use of available resources; describes milestones in terms of what is achieved and delivered; allocates decision making authority and task responsibilities to appropriate team members; monitors the progress of plans and ensures that action is taken to resolve delays; anticipates and promptly raises operational or resource issues.

Change Management: Maintains a sense of pace and urgency in self so that change initiatives do not stagnate.

Resilience/assertiveness: Effectively deals with work related problems, pressure, and stress in a professional and positive manner; recovers quickly when faced with obstacles or setbacks.

Communication: Possesses the ability to listen, read body language, ask questions, provide feedback, and generate two-way communication to build trust; engage in a variety of communication styles to articulate goals and objectives; providing timely and relevant information that allows team members to fully participate; effectively deliver information to an audience in a formal setting.

Flexibility: To deliver services effectively, a degree of flexibility is required. The successful candidate may be required to perform work not specifically referred to above.

 

Requirements

Education/Certification/Designation

·       College in technical degree (IT related field)

·       PMI certification (or within 2 years of obtaining OR interest to obtain)

Skills/Knowledge

·       Advanced knowledge of tools and techniques (MS-Project, Excel, PPM tools (Project Portfolio Management tools))

·       Good understanding of project financial management

Experience

·  More than 3 to 5 years as an IT PM, leading small to medium size projects (<1M$)

-  Strong analytical skills, with detail oriented and problem solving mindset;

- Support project financials and participate in monthly project forecasting exercise;

- Track project forecasting accuracy and produce review reports on a monthly/quarterly basis;

- Working with Finance and PCOs for month-end activities, including accruals, GR’s, Journal Entries and reconciliation tasks;

- Exercise and follow project financial governance process and ensure the data integrity of all systems (SAP, MSP, Apptio), and investigate when discrepancies arise;

- Ad-hoc financial analysis reports to support decision making in project management;

- Assist in streamlining of Capex and Opex budget;

- Assist in project budget approval process;

- Assist in audit related tasks;

- Knowledge of MS Project planning tool will be an asset;

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. item.title: Specialist Data Design
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Specialist, Data Design is responsible for understanding business requirements, creating data definitions, business rules, data quality requirements, as well as logical and physical models. The role supervises and maintains the Data Management (DM) practice within the team. The incumbent brings technical expertise to ensure the quality and accuracy of data, then process, designs and presents it in ways to help people, businesses, and organizations make better decisions. The position ensures data integrity and normalization, and oversees and designs the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.



Main Responsibilities

Data Design and Management

·       Build conceptual, logical, and physical data models using Erwin

·       Build source to target mapping documents to describe data transformations

·       Design and develop curated data assets in Data Lake and Data Warehouse to support operational reporting, data science and self-service analytics

·       Define, document, and maintain standards and best practices around data modelling

·       Perform DM reviews

·       Handle the onboarding, support and mentorship of new data modellers

·       Perform profiling and analyze data using Structures Query Language (SQL) and Python on multiple sources (e.g., Oracle, Netezza, SQL-Server, Databricks, etc.)

Testing, Troubleshooting and Delivery 

·       Assess and design data architecture components (e.g., data model, mapping, data flows, and transformations) to make sure they are well integrated and aligned with the data and technical architecture

·       Troubleshoot data issues within the business and present solutions and recommendations

·       Define unit testing to ensure Data Engineers follow specifications

·       Participate in the delivery and support of data quality and consolidation initiatives

·       Propose simplification initiatives to allow for more effective data design, and management

·       Provide analytical support by developing dashboards and reports using Power BI or Tableau to deliver business insight

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday.

Requirements

Experience

Data Design and Modelling

·       Between 5 to 7 years overall work experience

o   Minimum 4 years of experience in analysis, data design and data modelling

o   Experience performing root cause analysis to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement

o   Experience in real time data streaming and loading*

o   Experience modelling data for data science projects*

o   Experience working with Scale Agile Methodology (SAFe)*

o   Experience with semi-structured and unstructured data*

 

*Any experience for these above would be considered as an asset

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree specializing in Mathematics and Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or other quantitative field, related degree, or equivalent experience

Competencies

·       Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing  

·       Applies analytical thinking 

·       Innovates through problem solving 

·       Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work 

·       Demonstrates organizational abilities 

·       Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity 

·       Works independently with little supervision 

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Advanced knowledge of Erwin Data Modeller r9.8 or similar version

·       Advanced knowledge of dimensional modelling techniques, data modelling and data architecture best practices

·       Advanced SQL skills

·       Knowledge of Azure Data Lake (ADLS), Data Warehouse, Data Factory, Development Operations (DevOps) Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD), GitHub, Databricks, and Business Intelligence or relevant data environment

item.title: Expert Solution Design (Data engineering)
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. Job Summary

The Expert Solution Design is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Expert Solution Design develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Engineering 

·       Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

·       Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

·       Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists

·       Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines

·       Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

·       Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

·       Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes

·       Promote effective data management practices

Data Design 

·       Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

·       Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

·       Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs

·       Expose the data into meaningful formats, like GraphQL

·       Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams

·       Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework

·       Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Development 

·       Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems

·       Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats

·       Conduct metadata management, data cleansing and preparation

·       Produce well documented quality codes

Data Operations - 10%

·       Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget

·       Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

·       Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

·       Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases

Data Quality Assurance 

·       Use Agile development practices for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines

·       Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

·       Maintain manual and automated test scripts

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and offers remote work.

 

Requirements

Experience

Data Engineering

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in a data engineering role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality

·       Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

·       Experience with at least 2 of the following technologies: Python, Scala, SQL, Java

·       Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, etc.

·       Experience with Cloud and non-Cloud based Hadoop ecosystem

·       Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks

·       Experience with traditional data warehousing and ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, Pentaho, DataStage)

·       Experience with Linux and shell scripting

·       Experience deploying applications into production environments such as code packaging, integration testing, monitoring and release management

·       Experience with multiple database technologies such as Distributed Processing (Spark, Hadoop, EMR), traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra)

·       Experience working in an Agile team environment

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering

·       Master’s Degree or PhD in Data Management, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field*

·       Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) Degree*

·       Google or Azure Data Engineering certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

·       Ability to communicate complex solutions

·       Applies analytical thinking

·       Innovates through problem solving

·       Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

·       Demonstrates organizational abilities and detail oriented

·       Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

·       Works independently with little supervision

·       Applies agile mindset

·       Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets

·       Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Strong data analytics and development skills

·       Demonstrated creativity skills

·       Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python

·       Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.

·       Expertise with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

·       Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability

·       Expertise with GraphQL*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. item.title: Senior Manager Cloud Security & DevSecOps Architecture
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

[The purpose of this role is to establish a Cloud security and DevSecOps practice, develop & mentor a team, and define cybersecurity reference architectures and standards for all Cloud environments at CN, and define processes for ensuring security through DevOps activities.

Main Responsibilities

Leading Others

  • Partner with HR to bring new talent to the organization by determining which skills and roles will be required in the future and by making thoughtful hiring decisions
  • Provide a positive and welcoming onboarding experience to all new employees by ensuring they have access to the tools and resources needed to fulfill the requirements of their job
  • Recognize employee milestones (service awards, retirements, etc.) as well as significant contributions and enhanced responsibilities
  • Focus on communications and foster collaboration by regularly providing updates to teams about ongoing initiatives and encouraging teams to work together to accomplish common goals and learning
  • Manage employee performance by ensuring employees who are not meeting expectations are identified and supported through the performance improvement process
  • Create and enable a positive and engaging work environment by ensuring individual strengths are uncovered and leveraged through frequent and focused conversations - collaborate, coach and build connections with employees
  • Participate in succession planning by contributing to the yearly talent review cycle and identifying employees with the potential to move up the management and expertise paths
  • Support employee development by having regular career conversations with all employees (documented and tracked) and supporting them in reaching their career goals
  • Ensure knowledge is preserved through cross-training for key skill sets in the team (knowledge transfer)

Cloud Security & DevSecOps Architecture Practice Development

  • Direct and put in place the proper sets of cloud security architecture controls to manage safety and security risk while enabling the business for technology systems such as: service-oriented-architectures; cloud technologies and containers; advanced analytics; AI; Industrial IoT;, networking infrastructure; mobile technologies; etc.
  • Ensure the cloud security architecture is maintainable, sustainable and properly documented
  • Maintain and build relevant, current, valid and reliable team knowledge related to cloud security architecture to leverage existing cybersecurity infrastructure and process, where appropriate, and drive configuration standards while supporting digital transformation in the I&T environment
  • Drive key decisions involving cloud architecture and technologies
  • Advance security team accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members
  • Ensure the full documentation of security designs, as built architectures and operational processes through clear diagrams and well-written documents

Cloud Security Roadmap and Strategy

  • Collaborate with the CISO, cybersecurity team, portfolio managers, other architects, and I&T leadership to understand the business direction and consequent impact on the security posture
  • Define the proper course of action and investment strategy by building business cases and security roadmaps
  • Engage the cloud vendor ecosystem to understand capabilities and limitations to drive improvements in the security posture of current products, and assist in the selection of the right partners
  • Engage the cybersecurity vendor ecosystem to understand capabilities, options for compensating controls and risk mitigations to facilitate the selection of partners that integrate with the overall architecture
  • Continuously monitor and evaluate the environment through self-assessments and independent security reviews. Enable management to identify deficiencies and inefficiencies and to initiate improvement actions though security roadmap and strategies

Working Conditions

Occasional business travel (Canada and US) in accordance with CN policy

Requirements

Experience

  • Minimum 15 years overall IT experience, preferably in software development
  • Minimum 10 years experience in software development security
  • Minimum 5 years experience in cloud security architecture
  • Multi-cloud experience including AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform (asset)
  • Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies (asset)
  • Experience in securing RPA functions and leveraging RPA for security tasks (asset)
  • Experience supervising and mentoring others is highly preferred (asset)
  • Railroad, transportation, or Global industrial experience is a significant plus (asset)

Education/Certification/Designation

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, System Analysis or other relevant field
  • Master’s degree in related field preferred
  • At least one recognized Cloud security certification: e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK), Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), GIAC Cloud Security Automation (GCSA) etc.
  • Architecture related certifications (TOGAF, Zachman, CISSP-ISSAP, etc.) preferred

Competencies

  • Ability to define and organise an architecture security apparatus in reusable building blocks: patterns, services, components, capability models, etc.
  • Demonstrated capability to understand the security implications of complex business operations and how they are linked to technological solutions that provide practical risk mitigation and business enablement
  • Significant and proven experience in applying a structured approach to problem resolution in large, geographically dispersed organizations with 24/7 operations
  • Ability to derive security requirements from vaguely formulated business needs
  • Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as business acumen
  • Detail-oriented self-starter with a high level of commitment and personal motivation
  • Knack for prioritizing tasks and working in a fast-paced environment

Technical Skills/Knowledge

  • Expert knowledge of the processes, methodologies, tools and techniques, used for building large information technology systems in private and public clouds
  • Knowledge of standards, regulations and legislation governing Information Security, e.g. NIST, ISO 27001, OWASP
  • Knowledge of general IT security architecture and technologies including: service-oriented-architectures, mobile technologies including Mobile Device Management (MDM), data-centric design, advanced analytics, AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) lifecycles, Digital Forensics, End Point Encryption, Encryption Key Management, Database Security, Enterprise Directory Services, IDS, IPS, Next Generation Firewall, Application Firewall, Enterprise Password Vaults , Cloud SaaS /PaaS/IaaS Security, SIEM, etc. (asset)
  • In depth understanding of securing APIs (asset)
  • Deep knowledge of container security, especially Kubernetes (asset)



Main Responsibilities

item.title: Terminal Coordinator Planner
item.description:
At CN, everyday brings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environment where you’re part of making sure our business is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We provide the kind of paid training and opportunities that long-term careers are built on and we recognize hard workers who strive to make a difference. You will be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The Terminal Coordinator Planner is responsible for leading the operational planning process to handle supply, demand, and terminal capacity with a reliance on tools, data and technology to drive decision making. The incumbent handles the planning of work orders to drive productivity and throughput for trains turn around and servicing of customers. Moreover, the role is responsible for overseeing the daily fluidity of their respective terminal or territory. Terminal fluidity is driven primarily by prioritizing safety through policy implementation, consistent process management and effective use of all available assets. The position also ensures management of assets in a way that enables cost effective loading and unloading of Intermodal trains and efficient service to the trucking community that uses CN terminals and with a view toward improvement and optimization of standard operating procedures.

Main Responsibilities

Operational Management process and Planning

·       Plan containers inventory for the creation of work orders and monitor productivity of all resources in the yard to successfully unload inbound trains and fully load outbound trains for on-time departures

·       Ensure development of a plan for all aspects of Intermodal terminal operations (e.g., demand of containers, supply of resources, train loading plan) and review plans quality and work towards improving it

·       Plan for the Sequencing of Work Orders (WO) considering Zone assignment

·       Communicate with supervisor and actively monitor WO status to handle equipment assignment according to operating conditions in the yard

·       Optimize use of the ground and wheel storage areas and the planning of container inventory allocations

·       Use available data to handle carter volume and congestion in the yard and assign resources accordingly

·       Collaborate with other departments and supply functions to improve planning aspects

Safety and Compliance Management

·       Maintain a safe work environment and control daily safety requirements

·       Validate rule compliance including positive feedback for compliance and appropriate follow-up for non-compliance

·       Provide coaching and formal statements

Staff Management 

·       Onboard, coach and mentor all employees on process changes and operational requirements

Trucking Management

·       Ensure trucking community is receiving timely service to limit truck driver dwells in the terminal

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with shift work including overnight hours, weekends, and holidays. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure and stress. The role requires minimal travel (up to 10%).

Requirements

Experience

Operations

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in an operation environment*

o   Experience leading a unionized environment*

o   Experience directing employees with safety sensitive or safety critical jobs

o   Experience in a 24/7 environment

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree with specialization in Operations, Supply Chain, Engineering, or Business*

·       Valid Driver’s Licence

·       First Aid Certification

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Leads by example for the safety and security of all

·       Considers ESG principles in all operations

·       Collaborates with others and shares information

·       Solves problems to create value

·       Demonstrates active listening

·       Sets direction and inspires others

·       Communicates with impact

·       Develops self and others

·       Applies critical thinking

·       Demonstrates agility and drives change

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Understanding of Safety Management principles

·       Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)

·       Knowledge of data analytics

·       Knowledge of business and management principles involved in operational planning, resource allocation, demand and supply, and process management

 

About CN

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.
